text: Who is the human author of the Book of Revelation?
verseText: The revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave him to show to his servants... John to the seven churches that are in Asia... I, John, your brother and partner in the tribulation...

text: Where was John when he received the visions recorded in Revelation?
verseText: I, John, your brother and partner in the tribulation and the kingdom and the patient endurance that are in Jesus, was on the island called Patmos on account of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus.

text: Revelation belongs to a genre of literature characterized by symbolic visions and prophecies about the end times, known as what?
verseText: (Revelation uses vivid imagery, symbolism, and prophecy typical of apocalyptic writings to reveal God's ultimate triumph over evil).

text: Chapters 2 and 3 of Revelation contain letters addressed to whom?
verseText: “Write what you see in a book and send it to the seven churches, to Ephesus and to Smyrna and to Pergamum and to Thyatira and to Sardis and to Philadelphia and to Laodicea.”

text: In John's vision in Revelation 4-5, who is found worthy to open the scroll with seven seals?
options: The Lamb who was slain (Jesus Christ)
verseText: And one of the elders said to me, “Weep no more; behold, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has conquered, so that he can open the scroll and its seven seals.” And between the throne and the four living creatures and among the elders I saw a Lamb standing, as though it had been slain... And he went and took the scroll from the right hand of him who was seated on the throne... “Worthy are you to take the scroll and to open its seals, for you were slain...”

text: The opening of the seven seals, the sounding of the seven trumpets, and the pouring out of the seven bowls represent what?
options: Series of divine judgments upon the earth
verseText: (These three series of seven depict escalating judgments poured out as God deals with sin and rebellion).

text: Who is the 'dragon' described in Revelation 12, who opposes the woman and her child?
verseText: And another sign appeared in heaven: behold, a great red dragon... And the great dragon was thrown down, that ancient serpent, who is called the devil and Satan, the deceiver of the whole world...

text: What symbolic name is given to the corrupt world system, depicted as a harlot city allied with the beast (Revelation 17-18)?
verseText: And on her forehead was written a name of mystery: “Babylon the great, mother of prostitutes and of earth's abominations.”... Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great!

text: Revelation 19 describes the return of Christ. How is He depicted?
options: As a victorious warrior King ('King of kings and Lord of lords') riding a white horse
As a baby in a manger
verseText: Then I saw heaven opened, and behold, a white horse! The one sitting on it is called Faithful and True, and in righteousness he judges and makes war... On his robe and on his thigh he has a name written, King of kings and Lord of lords.

text: What does Revelation 21-22 describe as the ultimate destiny for believers?
options: An eternal spiritual existence without bodies
A new heaven and a new earth, with the New Jerusalem where God dwells with His people
verseText: Then I saw a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away... And I saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God... And I heard a loud voice from the throne saying, “Behold, the dwelling place of God is with man. He will dwell with them, and they will be his people, and God himself will be with them as their God.”

text: What title does Jesus use for Himself in Revelation 1, referring to the beginning and the end?
verseText: “I am the Alpha and the Omega,” says the Lord God, “who is and who was and who is to come, the Almighty.” ... “Fear not, I am the first and the last, and the living one. I died, and behold I am alive forevermore...

text: In John's vision of the glorified Christ in chapter 1, what do the seven stars represent?
options: The seven angels of the seven churches
verseText: In his right hand he held seven stars... As for the mystery of the seven stars that you saw in my right hand... the seven stars are the angels of the seven churches...

text: What do the seven golden lampstands represent in John's initial vision?
options: The seven gifts of the Spirit
verseText: ...and turning I saw seven golden lampstands... and the seven lampstands are the seven churches.

text: Which church is commended for its deeds, love, faith, service, and patient endurance, but warned against tolerating 'that woman Jezebel'?
verseText: “‘I know your works, your love and faith and service and patient endurance, and that your latter works exceed the first. But I have this against you, that you tolerate that woman Jezebel, who calls herself a prophetess and is teaching and seducing my servants...'

text: Which church is described as 'lukewarm, neither cold nor hot'?
verseText: “‘I know your works: you are neither cold nor hot. Would that you were either cold or hot! So, because you are lukewarm, and neither hot nor cold, I will spit you out of my mouth.'

text: Which church is told it has a reputation for being alive, but is actually dead?
verseText: “And to the angel of the church in Sardis write: ‘The words of him who has the seven spirits of God and the seven stars. “‘I know your works. You have the reputation of being alive, but you are dead.'

text: Which church is commended for keeping God's word and not denying His name, despite having little strength, and is promised an open door?
verseText: “‘I know your works. Behold, I have set before you an open door, which no one is able to shut. I know that you have but little power, and yet you have kept my word and have not denied my name.'

text: Which church is warned that it has abandoned the love it had at first?
verseText: But I have this against you, that you have abandoned the love you had at first. Remember therefore from where you have fallen; repent, and do the works you did at first.

text: Which church is told it will suffer tribulation and poverty (though rich spiritually) but should not fear?
verseText: “‘I know your tribulation and your poverty (but you are rich) and the slander of those who say that they are Jews and are not, but are a synagogue of Satan. Do not fear what you are about to suffer...'

text: Which church is located where 'Satan's throne is' and commended for holding fast to Christ's name even when Antipas was martyred?
verseText: “‘I know where you dwell, where Satan's throne is. Yet you hold fast my name, and you did not deny my faith even in the days of Antipas my faithful witness, who was killed among you, where Satan dwells.'

text: What recurring phrase promises reward to the one who 'conquers' or 'overcomes' at the end of each letter to the churches?
options: 'will sit with me on my throne'
(A specific promise unique to each church, e.g., 'eat of the tree of life', 'receive the hidden manna')
verseText: (Each letter concludes with a promise to the overcomer, such as eating from the tree of life, not being hurt by the second death, receiving hidden manna and a white stone, etc.)

text: In the throne room vision (Revelation 4), what surrounds the throne?
verseText: Around the throne were twenty-four thrones, and seated on the thrones were twenty-four elders, clothed in white garments, with golden crowns on their heads.

text: What creatures are described as being around the throne, full of eyes, constantly worshipping God?
options: Four living creatures (like a lion, ox, man, eagle)
verseText: and around the throne, on each side of the throne, are four living creatures, full of eyes in front and behind: the first living creature like a lion, the second living creature like an ox, the third living creature with the face of a man, and the fourth living creature like an eagle in flight... day and night they never cease to say, “Holy, holy, holy, is the Lord God Almighty, who was and is and is to come!”

text: What is the appearance of the Lamb who takes the scroll in Revelation 5?
options: As though it had been slain
verseText: And between the throne and the four living creatures and among the elders I saw a Lamb standing, as though it had been slain, with seven horns and with seven eyes, which are the seven spirits of God sent out into all the earth.

text: What do the four horsemen unleashed by the first four seals generally represent?
options: The four corners of the earth
verseText: (The white horse represents conquest/Antichrist, the red horse represents war, the black horse represents famine, and the pale horse represents death).

text: When the fifth seal is opened, what does John see under the altar?
options: The souls of martyrs crying out for justice
verseText: When he opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those who had been slain for the word of God and for the witness they had borne. They cried out with a loud voice, “O Sovereign Lord, holy and true, how long before you will judge and avenge our blood on those who dwell on the earth?”

text: What cosmic disturbances occur when the sixth seal is opened?
options: A great earthquake, sun darkened, moon like blood, stars falling
The sky rolls up like a scroll but nothing else happens
verseText: When he opened the sixth seal, I looked, and behold, there was a great earthquake, and the sun became black as sackcloth, the full moon became like blood, and the stars of the sky fell to the earth... The sky vanished like a scroll that is being rolled up...

text: Before the seventh seal is opened, how many individuals are sealed from the tribes of Israel?
verseText: And I heard the number of the sealed, 144,000, sealed from every tribe of the sons of Israel.

text: Besides the 144,000, what other group does John see before the throne in Revelation 7?
options: A great multitude from every nation, tribe, people, and language
verseText: After this I looked, and behold, a great multitude that no one could number, from every nation, from all tribes and peoples and languages, standing before the throne and before the Lamb, clothed in white robes, with palm branches in their hands,

text: What happens in heaven when the seventh seal is opened?
options: Silence for about half an hour
verseText: When the Lamb opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.

text: The sounding of the seven trumpets brings judgments primarily affecting what?
options: The natural world (earth, sea, rivers, sun, moon, stars)
verseText: (The first four trumpets bring hail and fire on the earth, a mountain burning into the sea, a star falling on the rivers, and the darkening of the sun, moon, and stars).

text: What comes out of the Abyss when the fifth trumpet sounds?
verseText: he opened the shaft of the bottomless pit... Then from the smoke came locusts on the earth... In appearance the locusts were like horses prepared for battle...

text: What is unleashed when the sixth trumpet sounds?
options: Four angels bound at the Euphrates River leading a demonic army
verseText: saying to the sixth angel who had the trumpet, “Release the four angels who are bound at the great river Euphrates.” So the four angels... were released to kill a third of mankind. The number of mounted troops was twice ten thousand times ten thousand...

text: In Revelation 10, John sees a mighty angel with one foot on the sea and one on the land holding what?
verseText: Then I saw another mighty angel coming down from heaven... He had a little scroll open in his hand. And he set his right foot on the sea, and his left foot on the land,

text: What is John commanded to do with the little scroll?
verseText: So I went to the angel and told him to give me the little scroll. And he said to me, “Take and eat it; it will make your stomach bitter, but in your mouth it will be sweet as honey.”

text: Who are the 'two witnesses' described in Revelation 11 who prophesy for 1,260 days?
verseText: And I will grant authority to my two witnesses, and they will prophesy for 1,260 days, clothed in sackcloth... They have the power to shut the sky, that no rain may fall... and they have power over the waters to turn them into blood and to strike the earth with every kind of plague...

text: What happens to the two witnesses after they finish their testimony?
options: They are killed by the beast from the abyss, lie dead, then resurrect and ascend
verseText: And when they have finished their testimony, the beast that rises from the bottomless pit will make war on them and conquer them and kill them... But after the three and a half days a breath of life from God entered them... Then they heard a loud voice from heaven saying to them, “Come up here!” And they went up to heaven in a cloud...

text: The 'woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet' in Revelation 12 is often interpreted as representing whom?
options: All of the above are common interpretations
verseText: And a great sign appeared in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars. She was pregnant and was crying out in birth pains and the agony of giving birth.

text: After war breaks out in heaven, where is the dragon (Satan) thrown?
verseText: And the great dragon was thrown down, that ancient serpent, who is called the devil and Satan, the deceiver of the whole world—he was thrown down to the earth, and his angels were thrown down with him.

text: Revelation 13 describes two beasts. Where does the first beast arise from?
verseText: And I saw a beast rising out of the sea, with ten horns and seven heads, with ten diadems on its horns and blasphemous names on its heads.

text: Where does the second beast (often identified as the False Prophet) arise from?
verseText: Then I saw another beast rising out of the earth. It had two horns like a lamb and it spoke like a dragon.

text: What does the second beast cause the inhabitants of the earth to do?
options: Worship the first beast and its image
verseText: It exercises all the authority of the first beast in its presence, and makes the earth and its inhabitants worship the first beast... and it deceives those who dwell on earth... telling them to make an image for the beast... And it was allowed to give breath to the image of the beast...

text: What infamous number is associated with the first beast, required for buying and selling?
verseText: so that no one can buy or sell unless he has the mark, that is, the name of the beast or the number of its name... let the one who has understanding calculate the number of the beast, for it is the number of a man, and his number is 666.

text: In contrast to those with the mark of the beast, where are the 144,000 seen standing with the Lamb in Revelation 14?
verseText: Then I looked, and behold, on Mount Zion stood the Lamb, and with him 144,000 who had his name and his Father's name written on their foreheads.

text: What message does the first of three angels flying in midheaven proclaim in Revelation 14?
options: Fear God and give him glory, worship the Creator
Warning about the mark of the beast
verseText: Then I saw another angel flying directly overhead, with an eternal gospel to proclaim to those who dwell on earth... And he said with a loud voice, “Fear God and give him glory, because the hour of his judgment has come, and worship him who made heaven and earth, the sea and the springs of water.”

text: What warning does the third angel give regarding worshipping the beast and its image?
options: They will drink the wine of God's wrath
They will be excluded from the New Jerusalem
verseText: And another angel, a third, followed them, saying with a loud voice, “If anyone worships the beast and its image and receives a mark on his forehead or on his hand, he also will drink the wine of God's wrath, poured full strength into the cup of his anger...

text: Revelation 14 uses metaphors of harvest to describe judgment. What are the two harvests?
verseText: (One like a son of man reaps the grain harvest of the earth; an angel reaps the grape harvest and throws it into the wine press of God's wrath).

text: What do the seven angels in Revelation 15 carry?
options: Seven bowls full of the wrath of God
verseText: Then I saw another sign in heaven, great and amazing, seven angels with seven plagues, which are the last, for with them the wrath of God is finished... And one of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels seven golden bowls full of the wrath of God...

text: What happens when the first bowl of wrath is poured out on the earth?
options: Painful sores afflict those with the mark of the beast
verseText: So the first angel went and poured out his bowl on the earth, and harmful and painful sores came upon the people who bore the mark of the beast and worshiped its image.

text: What happens to the kingdom of the beast when the fifth bowl is poured out?
verseText: The fifth angel poured out his bowl on the throne of the beast, and its kingdom was plunged into darkness. People gnawed their tongues in anguish

text: What river is dried up when the sixth bowl is poured out, preparing the way for the kings from the east?
verseText: The sixth angel poured out his bowl on the great river Euphrates, and its water was dried up, to prepare the way for the kings from the east.

text: Where are the demonic spirits from the dragon, beast, and false prophet gathering the kings of the world for battle?
verseText: For they are demonic spirits, performing signs, who go abroad to the kings of the whole world, to assemble them for battle on the great day of God the Almighty... And they assembled them at the place that in Hebrew is called Armageddon.

text: What happens when the seventh bowl is poured into the air?
options: A voice saying 'It is done!', followed by massive earthquake and hail
verseText: The seventh angel poured out his bowl into the air, and a loud voice came out of the temple, from the throne, saying, “It is done!” And there were flashes of lightning, rumblings, peals of thunder, and a great earthquake... And great hailstones, about one hundred pounds each, fell from heaven on people...

text: How is 'Babylon the Great' depicted in Revelation 17?
options: As a great harlot riding on a scarlet beast
verseText: And he carried me away in the Spirit into a wilderness, and I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet beast that was full of blasphemous names, and it had seven heads and ten horns. The woman was arrayed in purple and scarlet... And on her forehead was written a name of mystery: “Babylon the great, mother of prostitutes and of earth's abominations.”

text: What is the ultimate fate of Babylon the Great described in Revelation 18?
options: It becomes the capital of the world
It is utterly destroyed and mourned by merchants
It merges with the New Jerusalem
verseText: Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great!... For this reason her plagues will come in a single day, death and mourning and famine, and she will be burned up with fire... And the merchants of the earth weep and mourn for her, since no one buys their cargo anymore.

text: What sound is heard from heaven celebrating the fall of Babylon and the marriage supper of the Lamb?
verseText: After this I heard what seemed to be the loud voice of a great multitude in heaven, crying out, “Hallelujah! Salvation and glory and power belong to our God”... Then I heard what seemed to be the voice of a great multitude... crying out, “Hallelujah! For the Lord our God the Almighty reigns. Let us rejoice and exult and give him the glory, for the marriage of the Lamb has come...”

text: Who is the bride prepared for the marriage supper of the Lamb?
verseText: ...for the marriage of the Lamb has come, and his Bride has made herself ready; it was granted her to clothe herself with fine linen, bright and pure”— for the fine linen is the righteous deeds of the saints.

text: What happens to the beast and the false prophet when Christ returns?
options: They are captured and thrown alive into the lake of fire
They are imprisoned in the Abyss
verseText: And the beast was captured, and with it the false prophet who in its presence had done the signs by which he deceived those who had received the mark of the beast and those who worshiped its image. These two were thrown alive into the lake of fire that burns with sulfur.

text: What happens to Satan at the beginning of the thousand-year reign (Millennium) described in Revelation 20?
options: He is bound and thrown into the Abyss
verseText: Then I saw an angel coming down from heaven, holding in his hand the key to the bottomless pit and a great chain. And he seized the dragon, that ancient serpent, who is the devil and Satan, and bound him for a thousand years, and threw him into the pit, and shut it and sealed it over him...

text: Who reigns with Christ during the thousand years?
options: Martyrs and those who did not worship the beast
verseText: Also I saw the souls of those who had been beheaded for the testimony of Jesus and for the word of God, and those who had not worshiped the beast or its image and had not received its mark on their foreheads or their hands. They came to life and reigned with Christ for a thousand years.

text: What happens when Satan is released after the thousand years?
options: He gathers nations (Gog and Magog) for a final battle against God's people
He is immediately thrown into the lake of fire
verseText: And when the thousand years are ended, Satan will be released from his prison and will come out to deceive the nations that are at the four corners of the earth, Gog and Magog, to gather them for battle...

text: What is the final, eternal destiny of Satan after the last battle?
options: Thrown into the lake of fire and sulfur
verseText: and the devil who had deceived them was thrown into the lake of fire and sulfur where the beast and the false prophet were, and they will be tormented day and night forever and ever.

text: What event takes place before the Great White Throne in Revelation 20?
options: The final judgment of the dead
The marriage supper of the Lamb
verseText: Then I saw a great white throne and him who was seated on it... And I saw the dead, great and small, standing before the throne, and books were opened... And the dead were judged by what was written in the books, according to what they had done.

text: What is the 'second death' mentioned in Revelation?
verseText: Then Death and Hades were thrown into the lake of fire. This is the second death, the lake of fire. And if anyone's name was not found written in the book of life, he was thrown into the lake of fire.

text: What descends from heaven in Revelation 21?
options: The Holy City, the New Jerusalem
verseText: And I saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

text: What will be absent from the New Jerusalem because God and the Lamb are its temple and light?
options: A physical temple and the sun/moon
verseText: And I saw no temple in the city, for its temple is the Lord God the Almighty and the Lamb. And the city has no need of sun or moon to shine on it, for the glory of God gives it light, and its lamp is the Lamb.

text: What flows from the throne of God and the Lamb in the New Jerusalem?
options: A river of the water of life
verseText: Then the angel showed me the river of the water of life, bright as crystal, flowing from the throne of God and of the Lamb

text: What grows on either side of the river of life, bearing fruit each month?
verseText: through the middle of the street of the city; also, on either side of the river, the tree of life with its twelve kinds of fruit, yielding its fruit each month. The leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations.

text: What promise is repeated three times near the end of Revelation?
verseText: “And behold, I am coming soon...” “Behold, I am coming soon, bringing my recompense with me...” He who testifies to these things says, “Surely I am coming soon.”

text: What warning is given to those who add to or take away from the words of the prophecy in Revelation?
options: Plagues will be added to them / their share in the tree of life removed
verseText: I warn everyone who hears the words of the prophecy of this book: if anyone adds to them, God will add to him the plagues described in this book, and if anyone takes away from the words of the book of this prophecy, God will take away his share in the tree of life and in the holy city, which are described in this book.

text: How does the Book of Revelation conclude?
options: With a blessing: 'The grace of the Lord Jesus be with all. Amen.'
verseText: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with all. Amen.

text: What sound accompanies the voice speaking to John like a trumpet at the beginning of his vision?
verseText: I was in the Spirit on the Lord's day, and I heard behind me a loud voice like a trumpet... His voice was like the roar of many waters.

text: In the description of the glorified Christ, what does the sharp two-edged sword coming out of His mouth represent?
options: The judging and discerning Word of God
verseText: In his right hand he held seven stars, from his mouth came a sharp two-edged sword... (cf. For the word of God is living and active, sharper than any two-edged sword... discerning the thoughts and intentions of the heart.)

text: To the church in Ephesus, what is the promised reward for overcoming?
options: A white stone with a new name
To eat of the tree of life
To be clothed in white garments
verseText: To the one who conquers I will grant to eat of the tree of life, which is in the paradise of God.

text: To the church in Smyrna, what is the promised reward for being faithful unto death?
options: To sit with Christ on His throne
verseText: Be faithful unto death, and I will give you the crown of life.

text: To the church in Pergamum, what specific false teachings were they tolerating?
options: The teaching of Balaam and the Nicolaitans
verseText: But I have a few things against you: you have some there who hold the teaching of Balaam... So also you have some who hold the teaching of the Nicolaitans.

text: To the church in Thyatira, what is promised to the overcomer regarding authority?
options: Authority over the nations, ruling with a rod of iron
verseText: The one who conquers and who keeps my works until the end, to him I will give authority over the nations, and he will rule them with a rod of iron...

text: To the church in Sardis, what is the promise for the few who have not 'soiled their garments'?
options: They will walk with Christ in white
They will become pillars in God's temple
They will never be erased from the book of life
verseText: Yet you have still a few names in Sardis, people who have not soiled their garments, and they will walk with me in white, for they are worthy.

text: To the church in Philadelphia, what specific protection is promised from the coming trial?
options: To be kept from the hour of trial coming upon the whole world
verseText: Because you have kept my word about patient endurance, I will keep you from the hour of trial that is coming on the whole world, to try those who dwell on the earth.

text: To the church in Laodicea, what counsel does Christ give them regarding their spiritual poverty?
options: To buy from Him gold refined by fire, white garments, and salve for their eyes
verseText: I counsel you to buy from me gold refined by fire, so that you may be rich, and white garments so that you may clothe yourself... and salve to anoint your eyes, so that you may see.

text: What is the appearance of the One seated on the throne in Revelation 4?
options: Like jasper and carnelian, with an emerald rainbow
verseText: And he who sat there had the appearance of jasper and carnelian, and around the throne was a rainbow that had the appearance of an emerald.

text: What do the twenty-four elders cast before the throne as they worship?
verseText: the twenty-four elders fall down before him who is seated on the throne and worship him... and they cast their crowns before the throne, saying, “Worthy are you, our Lord and God...”

text: What specific characteristic is mentioned about the Lamb having seven horns and seven eyes?
options: They represent the seven spirits of God sent into all the earth
verseText: ...a Lamb standing, as though it had been slain, with seven horns and with seven eyes, which are the seven spirits of God sent out into all the earth.

text: What do the elders hold in their hands along with harps in Revelation 5?
options: Golden bowls full of incense, which are the prayers of the saints
verseText: ...the twenty-four elders fell down before the Lamb, each holding a harp, and golden bowls full of incense, which are the prayers of the saints.

text: What color is the horse of the rider who represents War, taking peace from the earth?
verseText: And out came another horse, bright red. Its rider was permitted to take peace from the earth, so that people should slay one another, and he was given a great sword.

text: What does the rider on the black horse carry, symbolizing famine and economic hardship?
verseText: And I looked, and behold, a black horse! And its rider had a pair of scales in his hand.

text: What authority is given to the rider on the pale horse, whose name is Death?
options: Authority over a fourth of the earth to kill
verseText: And I looked, and behold, a pale horse! And its rider's name was Death, and Hades followed him. And they were given authority over a fourth of the earth, to kill with sword and with famine and with pestilence and by wild beasts of the earth.

text: What are the martyrs under the altar given when they cry out for justice?
options: White robes and told to rest a little longer
verseText: Then they were each given a white robe and told to rest a little longer, until the number of their fellow servants and their brothers should be complete, who were to be killed as they themselves had been.

text: During the sixth seal's cosmic disturbances, where do people try to hide?
options: In caves and among the rocks of the mountains
verseText: Then the kings of the earth and the great ones... hid themselves in the caves and among the rocks of the mountains, calling to the mountains and rocks, “Fall on us and hide us...”

text: From which tribe of Israel are people NOT listed among the 144,000 sealed?
verseText: (The list includes Judah, Reuben, Gad, Asher, Naphtali, Manasseh, Simeon, Levi, Issachar, Zebulun, Joseph, Benjamin, but omits Dan and Ephraim, though Joseph and Manasseh represent Ephraim's lineage).

text: The great multitude standing before the throne in Revelation 7 are said to have come out of what?
verseText: And he said to me, “These are the ones coming out of the great tribulation. They have washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.”

text: What happens to a third of the trees and all green grass when the first trumpet sounds?
verseText: The first angel blew his trumpet, and there followed hail and fire, mixed with blood, and these were thrown upon the earth. And a third of the earth was burned up, and a third of the trees were burned up, and all green grass was burned up.

text: What happens to a third of the sea creatures and ships when the second trumpet sounds?
verseText: A great mountain, burning with fire, was thrown into the sea, and a third of the sea became blood. A third of the living creatures in the sea died, and a third of the ships were destroyed.

text: What is the name of the star that falls on the rivers and springs when the third trumpet sounds, making the water bitter?
verseText: The third angel blew his trumpet, and a great star fell from heaven, blazing like a torch, and it fell on a third of the rivers and on the springs of water. The name of the star is Wormwood. A third of the waters became wormwood, and many people died from the water, because it had been made bitter.

text: What celestial bodies are struck so that a third of their light is darkened when the fourth trumpet sounds?
verseText: The fourth angel blew his trumpet, and a third of the sun was struck, and a third of the moon, and a third of the stars, so that a third of their light might be darkened, and a third of the day might be kept from shining, and likewise a third of the night.

text: What creature flies through midheaven crying 'Woe, woe, woe' after the first four trumpet judgments?
verseText: Then I looked, and I heard an eagle crying with a loud voice as it flew directly overhead, “Woe, woe, woe to those who dwell on the earth, at the blasts of the other trumpets that the three angels are about to blow!”

text: Who is the 'king' over the demonic locusts released from the Abyss?
verseText: They have as king over them the angel of the bottomless pit. His name in Hebrew is Abaddon, and in Greek he is called Apollyon.

text: For how long are the demonic locusts permitted to torment (but not kill) mankind?
verseText: They were allowed to torment them for five months, but not to kill them... They have tails and stings like scorpions, and their power to hurt people for five months is in their tails.

text: Despite the horrific plagues of the sixth trumpet (killing a third of mankind), what is the reaction of the rest of humanity?
options: They did not repent of their idolatry, murders, sorceries, sexual immorality, or thefts
verseText: The rest of mankind, who were not killed by these plagues, did not repent of the works of their hands nor give up worshiping demons and idols... nor did they repent of their murders or their sorceries or their sexual immorality or their thefts.

text: What does the mighty angel in Revelation 10 declare when he lifts his hand to heaven?
options: That there would be no more delay
verseText: And the angel whom I saw standing on the sea and on the land raised his right hand to heaven and swore... that there would be no more delay,

text: What part of the temple complex is John told NOT to measure because it is given over to the nations?
verseText: Then I was given a measuring rod... “Rise and measure the temple of God and the altar and those who worship there, but do not measure the court outside the temple; leave that out, for it is given over to the nations...”

text: How long will the nations trample the holy city?
options: All of the above (different ways of saying the same period)
verseText: ...and they will trample the holy city for forty-two months.

text: What specific powers are granted to the two witnesses during their prophecy?
options: Shutting the sky, turning water to blood, striking the earth with plagues
verseText: They have the power to shut the sky, that no rain may fall during the days of their prophesying, and they have power over the waters to turn them into blood and to strike the earth with every kind of plague, as often as they desire.

text: What happens in the city when the two witnesses ascend to heaven after their resurrection?
options: A severe earthquake destroying a tenth of the city and killing 7,000 people
verseText: And at that hour there was a great earthquake, and a tenth of the city fell. Seven thousand people were killed in the earthquake, and the rest were terrified and gave glory to the God of heaven.

text: What announcement is made in heaven when the seventh trumpet sounds?
options: The kingdom of the world has become the kingdom of our Lord and of his Christ
verseText: Then the seventh angel blew his trumpet, and there were loud voices in heaven, saying, “The kingdom of the world has become the kingdom of our Lord and of his Christ, and he shall reign forever and ever.”

text: In the symbolic vision of Revelation 12, where does the woman flee for protection from the dragon?
options: Into the wilderness, to a place prepared by God
verseText: and the woman fled into the wilderness, where she has a place prepared by God, in which she is to be nourished for 1,260 days... But the woman was given the two wings of the great eagle so that she might fly from the serpent into the wilderness, to the place where she is to be nourished...

text: Who leads the angelic forces fighting against the dragon (Satan) and his angels in the war in heaven?
verseText: Now war arose in heaven, Michael and his angels fighting against the dragon. And the dragon and his angels fought back,

text: How do the brethren in heaven overcome Satan, according to the song of victory?
options: By the blood of the Lamb and the word of their testimony
verseText: And they have conquered him by the blood of the Lamb and by the word of their testimony, for they loved not their lives even unto death.

text: What does the dragon do when he realizes he has been thrown down to earth?
options: Pursues the woman who had given birth to the male child
verseText: And when the dragon saw that he had been thrown down to the earth, he pursued the woman who had given birth to the male child.

text: The first beast from the sea is described as having characteristics resembling which animals?
verseText: And the beast that I saw was like a leopard; its feet were like a bear's, and its mouth was like a lion's mouth. And to it the dragon gave his power and his throne and great authority.

text: What appears to have happened to one of the heads of the first beast?
options: It had received a mortal wound that was healed
It was larger than the others
verseText: One of its heads seemed to have a mortal wound, but its mortal wound was healed, and the whole earth marveled as they followed the beast.

text: How long is the first beast given authority to act?
verseText: And the beast was given a mouth uttering haughty and blasphemous words, and it was allowed to exercise authority for forty-two months.

text: What specific actions does the second beast (from the earth) perform to deceive people?
options: Performs great signs, like making fire come down from heaven
verseText: It performs great signs, even making fire come down from heaven to earth in front of people, and by the signs that it is allowed to work in the presence of the beast it deceives those who dwell on earth...

text: What is the consequence for those who refuse to worship the image of the first beast?
verseText: And it was allowed to give breath to the image of the beast, so that the image of the beast might even speak and might cause those who would not worship the image of the beast to be slain.

text: What identifying mark do the 144,000 have on their foreheads in Revelation 14?
options: The Lamb's name and His Father's name
verseText: Then I looked, and behold, on Mount Zion stood the Lamb, and with him 144,000 who had his name and his Father's name written on their foreheads.

text: What characteristic is specifically mentioned about the 144,000, describing their purity and devotion?
options: They have not defiled themselves with women (often interpreted as spiritual purity/devotion); they follow the Lamb wherever He goes
verseText: It is these who have not defiled themselves with women, for they are virgins. It is these who follow the Lamb wherever he goes. These have been redeemed from mankind as firstfruits for God and the Lamb,

text: What message does the second angel flying in midheaven proclaim in Revelation 14?
options: Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great
Warning about the mark of the beast
The hour of judgment has come
verseText: And another angel, a second, followed, saying, “Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great, she who made all nations drink the wine of the passion of her sexual immorality.”

text: Where is the 'wine press' located into which the grapes of wrath are thrown in the second harvest?
verseText: And the winepress was trodden outside the city, and blood flowed from the winepress, as high as a horse's bridle, for 1,600 stadia.

text: Before the seven bowls are poured out, John sees victors standing beside what?
options: A sea of glass mixed with fire
verseText: And I saw what appeared to be a sea of glass mingled with fire—and also those who had conquered the beast and its image and the number of its name, standing beside the sea of glass with harps of God in their hands.

text: What song do the victors by the sea of glass sing?
options: A new song known only to them
The song of Moses and the song of the Lamb
verseText: And they sing the song of Moses, the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying, “Great and amazing are your deeds, O Lord God the Almighty! Just and true are your ways, O King of the nations!”

text: What happens to the rivers and springs of water when the third bowl is poured out?
verseText: The third angel poured out his bowl into the rivers and the springs of water, and they became blood.

text: What happens to people when the fourth bowl is poured out on the sun?
options: They are scorched by intense heat
verseText: The fourth angel poured out his bowl on the sun, and it was allowed to scorch people with fire. They were scorched by the fierce heat...

text: Despite the plagues from the bowls of wrath, including darkness and sores, what is the reaction of those afflicted?
options: They repented and gave God glory
They cursed God and did not repent
verseText: ...They were scorched by the fierce heat, and they cursed the name of God who had power over these plagues. They did not repent and give him glory... and cursed the God of heaven for their pain and sores. They did not repent of their deeds... people cursed God for the plague of the hail, because the plague was so severe.

text: What comes out of the mouths of the dragon, the beast, and the false prophet to gather the kings for battle?
verseText: And I saw, coming out of the mouth of the dragon and out of the mouth of the beast and out of the mouth of the false prophet, three unclean spirits like frogs.

text: The great earthquake accompanying the seventh bowl is described as being how severe?
options: So great that no earthquake like it had ever occurred
verseText: ...and a great earthquake such as there had never been since man was on the earth, so great was that earthquake.

text: What happens to the 'great city' (often interpreted as Babylon or Jerusalem) during the seventh bowl earthquake?
options: It is split into three parts
verseText: The great city was split into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell, and God remembered Babylon the great, to make her drain the cup of the wine of the fury of his wrath.

text: The angel explains that the seven heads of the beast the harlot rides represent what two things?
verseText: This calls for a mind with wisdom: the seven heads are seven mountains on which the woman is seated; they are also seven kings,

text: What will the ten horns (representing kings allied with the beast) eventually do to the harlot Babylon?
options: Hate her, make her desolate and naked, devour her flesh, and burn her up with fire
verseText: And the ten horns that you saw, they and the beast will hate the prostitute. They will make her desolate and naked, and devour her flesh and burn her up with fire,

text: What specific command is given to God's people regarding Babylon the Great in Revelation 18?
verseText: Then I heard another voice from heaven saying, “Come out of her, my people, lest you take part in her sins, lest you share in her plagues;

text: What specific luxury goods are mentioned that merchants will no longer sell after Babylon's fall?
options: Gold, silver, jewels, pearls, fine linen, purple, silk, scarlet cloth, etc.
verseText: And the merchants of the earth weep and mourn for her... cargo of gold, silver, jewels, pearls, fine linen, purple, silk, scarlet cloth, all kinds of scented wood, all kinds of articles of ivory, all kinds of articles of costly wood, bronze, iron and marble, cinnamon, spice, incense, myrrh, frankincense, wine, oil, fine flour, wheat, cattle and sheep, horses and chariots, and slaves, that is, human souls.

text: What action symbolizes the final, irreversible destruction of Babylon the Great in Revelation 18?
options: A mighty angel throwing a great millstone into the sea
verseText: Then a mighty angel took up a stone like a great millstone and threw it into the sea, saying, “So will Babylon the great city be thrown down with violence, and will be found no more;

text: What are the armies in heaven following Christ clothed in?
verseText: And the armies of heaven, arrayed in fine linen, white and pure, were following him on white horses.

text: What happens to the armies gathered against Christ at Armageddon?
options: They are killed by the sword coming from the mouth of the Rider on the white horse
verseText: And the rest were slain by the sword that came from the mouth of him who was sitting on the horse, and all the birds were gorged with their flesh.

text: The reign of Christ with the saints for a thousand years is often referred to by what theological term?
verseText: (This period is described as lasting one thousand years, hence the term 'Millennium' from Latin 'mille' (thousand) and 'annum' (year)).

text: What is the 'first resurrection' mentioned in Revelation 20?
options: The resurrection of believers to reign with Christ
The resurrection of the wicked for judgment
verseText: The rest of the dead did not come to life until the thousand years were ended. This is the first resurrection. Blessed and holy is the one who shares in the first resurrection! Over such the second death has no power, but they will be priests of God and of Christ, and they will reign with him for a thousand years.

text: What happens to the armies of Gog and Magog gathered by Satan after the Millennium?
options: Fire comes down from heaven and consumes them
verseText: And they marched up over the broad plain of the earth and surrounded the camp of the saints and the beloved city, but fire came down from heaven and consumed them,

text: Besides the 'books' recording deeds, what other book is opened at the Great White Throne judgment?
verseText: ...and books were opened. Then another book was opened, which is the book of life. And the dead were judged by what was written in the books, according to what they had done.

text: In the New Jerusalem, what precious materials are the city's wall, foundations, gates, and street made of?
options: Jasper, various precious stones, pearls, and pure gold
verseText: The wall was built of jasper, while the city was pure gold, like clear glass. The foundations... were adorned with every kind of jewel... And the twelve gates were twelve pearls... and the street of the city was pure gold, like transparent glass.

text: Who is allowed to enter the New Jerusalem?
options: Only those whose names are written in the Lamb's book of life
verseText: But nothing unclean will ever enter it, nor anyone who does what is detestable or false, but only those who are written in the Lamb's book of life.

text: What will no longer exist in the new heaven and new earth described in Revelation 21?
verseText: Then I saw a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away, and the sea was no more.

text: What curse from Genesis is explicitly stated to be absent in the New Jerusalem?
options: The curse of pain in childbirth
No longer any curse (from the Fall)
verseText: No longer will there be anything accursed, but the throne of God and of the Lamb will be in it, and his servants will worship him.

text: What will the servants of God do in the New Jerusalem?
options: Worship Him, see His face, and reign forever and ever
verseText: ...his servants will worship him. They will see his face, and his name will be on their foreheads... And they will reign forever and ever.

text: Who identifies himself as both 'the root and the descendant of David' near the end of the book?
verseText: “I, Jesus, have sent my angel to testify to you about these things for the churches. I am the root and the descendant of David, the bright morning star.”

text: What invitation is extended by the Spirit and the Bride in the final chapter?
options: 'Come!' (inviting the thirsty to take the water of life)
verseText: The Spirit and the Bride say, “Come.” And let the one who hears say, “Come.” And let the one who is thirsty come; let the one who desires take the water of life without price.

text: What is John's final recorded prayer or response in the Book of Revelation?
verseText: He who testifies to these things says, “Surely I am coming soon.” Amen. Come, Lord Jesus!
